questions.question: He asked me whether either of the applicants ……………….. suitable.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after either, neither, each, everyone and many a.

questions.question: Each of these minerals …………………. found in India.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after either, neither, each, everyone and many a.

questions.question: Many a man ……………………….. died at sea.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after either, neither, each, everyone and many a.

questions.question: Either you or he ……………………… mistaken.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after either, neither, each, everyone and many a.

questions.question: Neither food nor water …………………….. given to the captives.
questions.description: When two singular nouns are connected by neither...nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Physics …………………….. a branch of science.
questions.description: Names of subjects are always treated as singular.

questions.question: The news ……………………….. too good to be true.
questions.description: News is an uncountable noun in English and as such it is followed by a singular verb.

questions.question: Plutarch’s Lives ……………………… an interesting story.
questions.description: When the plural noun is the name of a book, magazine or movie, it is followed by a singular verb.

questions.question: The committee ……………………….. submitted its report.
questions.description: Collective nouns are usually treated as singular.

questions.question: Six miles …………………………… a long distance.
questions.description: When the plural noun denotes some specific quantity or amount considered as a whole, the verb is usually singular.

questions.question: Justice as well as mercy …………………… it.
questions.description: When two nouns are connected with as well as, the verb agrees with the first noun.

questions.question: The house with its contents …………………….. insured.
questions.description: When two nouns are connected with 'with', the verb agrees with the first noun.
